meanings.definition: To cry out or scream loudly
meanings.sent1: The child would skreigh whenever he saw a spider.
meanings.sent2: She skreighed for help when she got lost in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The parrot decided to skreigh along with the sirens passing by.
meanings.sent4: The wind made the trees skreigh in the stormy night.
meanings.sent5: The haunted house made her skreigh in fear.

meanings.sent1: The skreigh of the fire alarm startled everyone in the building.
meanings.sent2: The skreigh of the brakes could be heard from far away.
meanings.sent3: The skreigh of the microphone feedback made the audience cover their ears.
meanings.sent4: The skreigh of the seagulls filled the air by the beach.
meanings.sent5: The skreigh of the tea kettle signaled it was ready.
